title: NL2SQL System for OSQuery
description: As an Assistant Professor, I guided the development of an AI-powered NL2SQL system for OSQuery. This system allows students and users to write natural language queries which are automatically converted into executable SQL statements. The approach involves a two-step process: first, intelligently retrieving relevant tables and columns from the database schema, and second, generating SQL queries using a fine-tuned CodeT5 model. The project emphasizes practical applications of Natural Language Processing, machine learning, and database management, bridging academic research with real-world cybersecurity and database analysis tasks.

title: Data Warehousing with Bronze, Silver, Gold Layers
description: In this research-oriented project, I supervised the design and implementation of a modern data warehouse pipeline using a layered architecture: Bronze (raw, unprocessed data ingestion), Silver (cleaned, normalized and transformed data), and Gold (aggregated, analytics-ready datasets). The project demonstrates best practices in ETL processes, data engineering, and academic research guidance. Students learned how to transform raw data into actionable insights and applied these techniques to real-world academic datasets, enabling efficient business intelligence reporting and research-driven analytics. My guidance ensured adherence to industry standards while maintaining a strong research perspective.
